There's no leavening, so the texture is similar to shortbread cookies. I recommend chilling the piped cookies for at least 20\u201330 minutes before baking.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "butter cookies", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/butter-cookies-3-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/butter-cookies-3-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/butter-cookies-3-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/butter-cookies-3.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/butter-cookies/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 cup (16 Tbsp; 226g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "3/4 cup (150g) granulated sugar", "1 and 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "1 teaspoon almond extract", "1 large egg, at room temperature", "2 and 1/4 cups (281g) all-purpose flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled)", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "1\u20132 Tablespoons (15\u201330ml) milk", "4 ounces (113) semi-sweet chocolate, finely chopped*", "maraschino cherries", "sprinkles or coarse sugar"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make room in your refrigerator for a baking sheet so the shaped cookies can chill for 20\u201330 minutes. Without chilling, the piped cookies will over-spread. If you chill the dough prior to shaping, the dough will be too cold/stiff to pipe.", "name": "Read through the recipe and recipe Notes before beginning", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/butter-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Line 2\u20133 large baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats, or leave unlined. If unlined, do not grease the pan.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/butter-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl, using a handheld mixer or a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter and granulated sugar together on medium-high speed until smooth, about 2 minutes. Add the egg, vanilla extract, and almond extract, and beat on high speed until combined, about 1 minute. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl and beat again as needed to combine.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/butter-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "On low speed, beat in the flour and salt. Turn up to high speed and beat until completely combined. On medium speed, beat in 1.5 Tablespoons of milk. You want a dough that&#8217;s creamy and pipe-able (but still thick), so you may need up to 2\u20132.5 Tablespoons of milk. The more milk you add, the more the cookies will spread, so chilling in step 6 is imperative. I recommend keeping the amount of milk small and using a large enough piping tip, like the ones I suggest in the post above.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/butter-cookies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add your large piping tip to the piping bag. Spoon a little bit of dough into the piping bag and pipe a 1\u20132-inch swirl or line on the prepared baking sheet. The reason I suggest only a little bit of dough to start is because the dough may still be too thick to pipe. If it&#8217;s too thick, transfer that dough back to the mixing bowl and add another 1/2 Tablespoon of milk. If the dough is creamy enough to pipe, continue piping the dough in 1\u20132-inch swirls or lines, 3 inches apart on the baking sheet. See video for a visual if needed. If desired, place a maraschino cherry in the center of the swirl or sprinkle the dough with sprinkles and/or coarse sugar.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/butter-cookies/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Transfer the baking sheet to the refrigerator and chill the shaped cookies for 20\u201330 minutes.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/butter-cookies/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/butter-cookies/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake the chilled cookies for 12\u201315 minutes or until lightly browned on the sides. The cookies will spread like all cookies do, but not completely lose their shape, especially if you chilled the shaped dough. If the cookies are smaller, they will take closer to 12 minutes. Keep your eye on them. They&#8217;re done when the edges lightly brown.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/butter-cookies/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove from the oven and allow to cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/butter-cookies/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "You can melt the chocolate in a\u00a0double boiler or the microwave. If using the microwave: place the chopped chocolate in a medium heatproof bowl. Melt in 20-second increments in the microwave, stirring after each increment until completely melted and smooth. Dip the cookies in chocolate and top with sprinkles, if desired. Allow the chocolate to set completely at room temperature for about 1 hour or in the refrigerator for 20 minutes.", "name": "Optional Chocolate", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/butter-cookies/#instruction-step-10"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Plain cookies stay fresh in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 1 week. Cookies with chocolate or cherries stay fresh in an airtight container at room temperature for 4 days or in the refrigerator for 1 week.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/butter-cookies/#instruction-step-11"}], "prepTime": "PT30M", "cookTime": "PT14M", "totalTime": "PT1H15M", "recipeYield": ["30", "30 cookies"], "recipeCategory": "Desserts", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "Danish", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "196", "ratingValue": "4.6"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "Homemade Butter Cookies | Sally's Baking Addiction", "description": "These homemade Danish butter cookies are soft in the center with irresistible buttery vanilla and almond flavors. Between the notes, video, and detailed step by step instructions, I was 100% confident I could produce a good result. I followed the recipe verbatim, and did not need to add any additional milk in order to pipe the cookies. \r\n\r\nThe piping was the one aspect of this recipe that had me a little worried. I've never piped anything other than \"happy birthday\", and that wasn't very good lol. The good news is they look perfect! Sprinkle the remaining 1/4 cup (50g) of sugar on top, then beat into stiff glossy peaks, about 1-2 minutes. (Stiff peaks hold their shape when you lift the beaters/whisk.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-pudding-cakes/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spoon about 1/3 of the egg whites into the lemon batter. Working slowly and carefully so as not to deflate the egg whites, gently fold together until combined. Gently fold in another 1/3 of the egg whites until combined, then fold in the remaining egg whites. Batter will be thick and airy.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/lemon-pudding-cakes/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Divide between greased ramekins, filling nearly to the top. See video above for a closer look at the texture. Place in the refrigerator or freezer as you mix the wet ingredients together.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cinnamon-chip-scones/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk 1/2 cup heavy cream, brown sugar, egg, and vanilla extract together in a small bowl. Press into an 8-inch disc and, with a sharp knife or bench scraper, cut into 8 wedges.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cinnamon-chip-scones/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Brush scones with remaining heavy cream and for extra crunch, sprinkle with coarse sugar. If you need enough to frost a layer cake, see recipe Notes below.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "brown butter cream cheese frosting", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/09/how-to-make-brown-butter-cream-cheese-frosting-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/09/how-to-make-brown-butter-cream-cheese-frosting-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/09/how-to-make-brown-butter-cream-cheese-frosting-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/09/how-to-make-brown-butter-cream-cheese-frosting.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-butter-cream-cheese-frosting/", "recipeIngredient": ["1/4 cup (4 Tbsp; 56g) unsalted butter, cut into 4 slices", "8 ounces (226g) full-fat brick cream cheese, softened to room temperature", "2 and 1/2 cups (300g) confectioners&#8217; sugar", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "pinch of salt"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Set out a medium heatproof bowl or glass liquid measuring cup because you\u2019ll need it at the end of this step. Place the sliced butter in a light-colored skillet or saucepan. A light-colored interior allows you to determine when the butter begins to brown. Melt the butter over medium heat, stirring or whisking constantly. Once melted, the butter will begin to foam. Continue stirring/whisking, keeping a close eye on it. After about 5\u20137 minutes, the butter will begin browning and you\u2019ll notice lightly browned specks forming at the bottom of the pan. The butter will have a nutty aroma. The color will gradually deepen, from yellow to golden to golden-brown; once it\u2019s a light caramel-brown color, immediately remove from heat and pour into the bowl; be sure to scrape out and include the brown solids that have formed on the bottom of the pan. Cool for 10 minutes at room temperature, then transfer to the refrigerator to cool completely and solidify.", "name": "Brown the butter", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-butter-cream-cheese-frosting/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the solidified brown butter on high speed until creamy and smooth, about 1 minute. Add the cream cheese and beat again until smooth and combined, about 2 minutes. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed. Add confectioners&#8217; sugar, vanilla, and salt. Beat on low speed for 30 seconds, then gradually increase to high speed and beat for 2 minutes.", "name": "Make the frosting", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-butter-cream-cheese-frosting/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spread the frosting on cooled cake or cupcakes. Add 1/2 cup shredded parmesan cheese, the salt, pepper, and roasted garlic. Fold in the spinach and all but 2 Tablespoons of the chopped bacon.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/roasted-garlic-and-bacon-spinach-dip/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spoon the dip into a 2.5 quart baking dish, such as a 9-inch square baking pan, 9-inch cast iron skillet, 9-inch pie dish, or anything close to that size. In these photos, I used a 7&#215;11-inch baking dish which holds the same volume. Bake for 18 minutes, remove from the oven, sprinkle evenly with remaining parmesan cheese and chopped bacon. Try them and you'll taste why! Feel free to garnish with a mini snickerdoodle cookie or a cinnamon stick.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "snickerdoodle cupcakes", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/10/cinnamon-swirl-snickerdoodle-cupcakes-2-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/10/cinnamon-swirl-snickerdoodle-cupcakes-2-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/10/cinnamon-swirl-snickerdoodle-cupcakes-2-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/10/cinnamon-swirl-snickerdoodle-cupcakes-2.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/snickerdoodle-cupcakes-cinnamon-swirl-frosting/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 and 2/3 cups (209g) all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled)", "1 teaspoon baking powder", "1/4 teaspoon baking soda", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "1/2 cup (8 Tbsp; 113g) unsalted butter, melted and slightly cooled", "1 and 1/3 cups (266g) granulated sugar, divided", "1 large egg, at room temperature", "1/4 cup (60g) sour cream or plain yogurt, at room temperature*", "3/4 cup (180ml) whole milk, at room temperature", "1 Tablespoon pure vanilla extract", "2 teaspoons ground cinnamon", "1 cup (16 Tbsp; 226g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "3-4 cups (360\u2013480g) confectioners&#8217; sugar", "1/4 cup (60ml) heavy cream, at room temperature", "2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "salt, to taste", "1 Tablespoon ground cinnamon", "optional\u00a0for garnish: 12 cinnamon sticks or 12 mini snickerdoodles*"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Line a 12-cup muffin pan with cupcake liners.", "name": "Make the cupcakes", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/snickerdoodle-cupcakes-cinnamon-swirl-frosting/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl, whisk the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together. Set aside. In a medium bowl, whisk the melted butter and 1 cup (200g) sugar together. Mixture will be gritty. Whisk in the egg, sour cream, milk, and vanilla extract until combined.", "name": "Make the cupcakes", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/snickerdoodle-cupcakes-cinnamon-swirl-frosting/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and whisk until the batter is completely combined. Batter should be creamy and mostly smooth; a few small lumps are OK.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/snickerdoodle-cupcakes-cinnamon-swirl-frosting/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a small bowl, mix the remaining 1/3 cup of sugar and 2 teaspoons cinnamon together. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/snickerdoodle-cupcakes-cinnamon-swirl-frosting/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spoon 2 scant Tablespoons of cupcake batter into each cupcake liner. Top with 1 teaspoon of the cinnamon-sugar mixture. Top with 1 heaping Tablespoon of cupcake batter, until the cupcake liners are about 3/4 full. Some of the cinnamon-sugar filling from the center layer may peek through the top layer of batter\u2014that&#8217;s ok. Top each cupcake with 1/4 teaspoon of cinnamon-sugar. Swirl each gently with a toothpick.", "name": "Assemble the cupcakes", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/snickerdoodle-cupcakes-cinnamon-swirl-frosting/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 20\u201322 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove cupcakes from the oven and allow them to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, and then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. Shake off any excess cinnamon-sugar that isn&#8217;t sticking to the tops, as that will prevent the frosting from sticking to the cupcakes.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/snickerdoodle-cupcakes-cinnamon-swirl-frosting/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "With a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle or whisk attachment, beat butter on high speed until smooth and creamy, about 1 minute. Add confectioners&#8217; sugar, heavy cream, and vanilla extract. Beat on low speed for 30 seconds, then switch to high speed and beat for 3 full minutes. Add more confectioners&#8217; sugar if frosting seems thin and greasy or more cream if the frosting seems too stiff. Taste, and add salt if frosting is too sweet (I like to add about 1/8 teaspoon). Remove half of the frosting from the mixing bowl and transfer to another bowl, or directly into your piping bag. Beat 1 Tablespoon of cinnamon into the remaining frosting in the mixing bowl.", "name": "Make the frosting", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/snickerdoodle-cupcakes-cinnamon-swirl-frosting/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spoon half cinnamon frosting into the piping bag and half vanilla frosting into the piping bag. See above for a visual. Pipe onto cupcakes. I used a Wilton 1M piping tip. Garnish cupcakes with cinnamon sticks or mini snickerdoodle cookies, if desired.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/snickerdoodle-cupcakes-cinnamon-swirl-frosting/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover and store leftover cupcakes at room temperature for up to 1 day or in the refrigerator for up to 5 days. Layer with vanilla wafer cookies and top with extra fluffy cinnamon spiced whipped cream.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "banana pudding, bananas, pudding", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/banana-pudding-with-whipped-cream-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/banana-pudding-with-whipped-cream-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/banana-pudding-with-whipped-cream-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/banana-pudding-with-whipped-cream.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/caramelized-banana-pudding/", "recipeIngredient": ["1/4 cup (4 Tbsp; 56g) unsalted butter", "1/2 cup (100g) packed light or dark brown sugar", "1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon", "5 large semi-ripe bananas, sliced into 1/4 inch slices (about 4 heaping cups)*", "2 and 1/4 cups (540ml) whole milk*", "1/2 cup\u00a0(120ml)\u00a0heavy cream*", "3/4 cup (150g) granulated sugar", "1/4 teaspoon\u00a0salt", "4\u00a0large\u00a0egg yolks", "1/4 cup\u00a0(30g)\u00a0cornstarch", "1\u00a0and 1/2 teaspoons\u00a0pure vanilla extract", "3 Tablespoons (43g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "about 50 vanilla wafer cookies (such as Nilla Wafers; one 11 ounce box is enough)*", "1 and 1/2 cups (360ml) heavy cream*", "1/4 cup (30g) confectioners&#8217; sugar", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon", "optional garnish: quartered banana slices and/or crumbled vanilla wafer cookies"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the butter, brown sugar, and cinnamon in a large skillet over medium heat. Constantly stir as the butter and sugar melt down. Add the bananas and cook until softened and slightly caramelized, about 3 minutes. *If you prefer a little more texture in your banana pudding, only cook the bananas for about 1-2 minutes.* Remove from heat and set aside.", "name": "Caramelized Bananas", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/caramelized-banana-pudding/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Combine the milk, heavy cream, sugar, and salt in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Whisk until all the sugar has dissolved, then bring to a gentle simmer, whisking occasionally. Working quickly as the milk mixture begins to simmer, whisk the egg yolks and cornstarch together in a medium heatproof bowl until very thick and smooth. Very slowly stream in about 3/4 cup (180ml) of the simmering milk to slightly warm the egg yolk mixture. Then, in a very slow stream, whisk the egg yolk mixture into the pan. While continuously whisking, cook until the mixture is thick and big bubbles begin bursting at the surface, about 1 minute. Remove the pan from heat and whisk in the vanilla extract and butter. Makes about 4 cups of pudding.", "name": "Pudding", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/caramelized-banana-pudding/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Use an ungreased 9-inch or any 2.5 quart baking dish. Line half of the vanilla wafers on the bottom. Evenly top with half of the caramelized bananas. Give the pudding a quick stir. If it has thickened considerably and isn&#8217;t pourable, whisk in a splash of milk to help thin out. Pour half of the warm pudding on top. Use a spoon to evenly spread around. Evenly top with remaining vanilla wafers, then the remaining caramelized bananas. Pour the rest of the pudding on top and spread into an even layer. Set aside, covered or uncovered, at room temperature or in the refrigerator as you make the whipped cream.", "name": "Assemble", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/caramelized-banana-pudding/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a hand mixer or a stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, whip the heavy cream, confectioners&#8217; sugar, vanilla extract, and cinnamon on medium-high speed until medium peaks form, about 3-4 minutes. Medium peaks are between soft/loose peaks and stiff peaks. Spread evenly on top of the pudding.", "name": "Whipped Cream", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/caramelized-banana-pudding/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover the pudding tightly and refrigerate for at least 4 hours and up to 24 hours. The vanilla wafers will soften during this time. They may taste too soggy after 1 full day and the bananas will begin to release some liquid, so for best taste and texture, serve within 24 hours.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/caramelized-banana-pudding/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To serve, spoon into individual bowls. Cover and store leftovers in the refrigerator for up to 2 days. I don&#8217;t recommend freezing this because of the high volume of liquid in the pudding, whipped cream, and bananas. The caramelized bananas won&#8217;t thaw very nicely either.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/caramelized-banana-pudding/#instruction-step-6"}], "prepTime": "PT40M", "cookTime": "PT15M", "totalTime": "PT4H55M", "recipeYield": ["9", "9-12 servings"], "recipeCategory": "Dessert", "cookingMethod": "Cooking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "29", "ratingValue": "4.7"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "Caramelized Banana Pudding  | Sally's Baking Addiction", "description": "Learn how to make caramelized banana pudding-- a fun variation of the Southern classic. No oil or butter, just bananas and Greek yogurt for a moist texture!", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "skinny raspberry banana muffins, raspberry chocolate chip banana muffins", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/07/raspberry-chocolate-chip-banana-muffins-2-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/07/raspberry-chocolate-chip-banana-muffins-2-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/07/raspberry-chocolate-chip-banana-muffins-2-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/07/raspberry-chocolate-chip-banana-muffins-2.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/skinny-raspberry-chocolate-chip-banana-muffins/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 and 1/2 cups (313g) white whole-wheat flour (spooned &amp; leveled), or a mix of whole-wheat and all-purpose flours", "1 teaspoon baking soda", "1/4 teaspoon salt", "1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon", "1/4 cup (85g) honey or pure maple syrup", "1/2 cup (100g) light or dark brown sugar, loosely packed", "1 cup (230g) mashed bananas (about 3 medium or 2 large ripe bananas)", "1/4 cup (60g) nonfat vanilla or plain Greek yogurt", "1 large egg, beaten", "3/4 cup (180ml) milk (any kind, dairy or nondairy)", "1/2 cup (90g) semi-sweet chocolate chips\u00a0(or less, depending on your taste)", "1 and 3/4 cups (220g) fresh or frozen raspberries"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Grease a\u00a012-count muffin pan with cooking spray or grease liners (muffins will stick to liners if not greased with a little cooking spray first!). This recipe yields about 15 muffins, so you will have a 2nd batch with only 3 muffins.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/skinny-raspberry-chocolate-chip-banana-muffins/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl, gently toss the flour, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon together until combined. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/skinny-raspberry-chocolate-chip-banana-muffins/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a separate bowl, whisk the honey and brown sugar together &#8211; it will be thick and lumpy. Try to get out as many lumps as you can. Add the mashed banana, yogurt, and beaten egg. Slowly pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients. Gently begin to fold it all together. It will be very thick. Add the milk slowly and continue to gently mix the ingredients together. The milk will thin everything out, but the batter will still remain thick. Fold in the chocolate chips. Fold in the raspberries last. Be very gentle not to dye the batter pink from the raspberry juices. Try to not overmix the batter, which will lend tough, dry muffins.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/skinny-raspberry-chocolate-chip-banana-muffins/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Divide the batter between 15 muffin tins. Fill all the way to the top. Sprinkle a few more chocolate chips on top if desired. Bake the first 12, then the last three in another batch. Fill the empty muffin tins halfway with water in the 2nd batch to ensure even baking and prevent your pan from warping. Bake for 17-18 minutes until very lightly browned on the edges. A toothpick inserted in the center should come out clean.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/skinny-raspberry-chocolate-chip-banana-muffins/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Allow the muffins to cool for 10 minutes in the muffin pan, then transfer to a wire rack to cool until ready to eat.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/skinny-raspberry-chocolate-chip-banana-muffins/#instruction-step-5"}], "prepTime": "PT25M", "cookTime": "PT18M", "totalTime": "PT1H", "recipeYield": ["15", "15 muffins"], "recipeCategory": "Muffins", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "10", "ratingValue": "4.6"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Lisa P"}, "datePublished": "2020-09-17", "reviewBody": "My daughter and I made these as snacks to munch on during our hurricane last week, and they were fabulous! Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix together with a large spoon or rubber spatula. The dough will be very soft. Fold in 1/2 cup white chocolate chips, if using. The chips may not stick to the dough because of the melted butter, but do your best to combine.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/white-chocolate-pumpkin-snickerdoodles/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover the dough and chill for 30 minutes or up to 3 days. Line two large baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/white-chocolate-pumpkin-snickerdoodles/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Scoop the dough, about 1.5 Tablespoons of dough per cookie, and roll each into balls. Mix the coating ingredients together, and then roll each cookie dough ball generously in the cinnamon-sugar coating. Arrange cookie dough balls 3 inches apart on the prepared baking sheets. Using the back of a spoon or the bottom of a cup/measuring cup, slightly flatten the tops of the dough balls. (Without doing so, the cookies may not spread.)", "name": "Shape &amp; coat the cookie dough balls", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/white-chocolate-pumpkin-snickerdoodles/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 11\u201312 minutes or until the edges appear set. The cookies will look very soft in the center. Remove from the oven. If you find that your cookies didn&#8217;t spread much at all, flatten them out gently with the back of a spoon when you take them out of the oven. Whisk the eggs, milk, parsley, salt, and pepper together in a large bowl. Pour evenly over meat + cheese. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/biscuit-breakfast-casserole/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the flour, baking powder, and salt together in a large bowl or use the food processor. Add the 6 Tablespoons of cubed butter and cut into the dry ingredients with a pastry cutter or pulse several times in the processor. Cut/pulse until coarse crumbs form. Add the milk, then stir/pulse until the dough comes together. Dough will be very shaggy and a little wet. If it&#8217;s too dry, add another Tablespoon of milk. With floured hands, form the biscuit dough into about 20 1.5 Tablespoon size balls. They don&#8217;t have to be perfect or neat, see my photo above as an example. Pretty in pastel shades, they're topped with my favorite royal icing and decorated like Easter eggs, PEEPS-inspired bunnies with marshmallow tails, and simple carrots. For simpler designs, like on the bunnies and carrots, you can use my easy glaze cookie icing.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "Easter cookies", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/easter-cookies-1-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/easter-cookies-1-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/easter-cookies-1-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/easter-cookies-1.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/easter-cookies/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 and 1/4 cups (281g) all-purpose flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled), plus more as needed for rolling and work surface", "1/2 teaspoon baking powder", "1/4 teaspoon salt", "3/4 cup (12 Tbsp; 170g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "3/4 cup (150g) granulated sugar", "1 large egg, at room temperature", "2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "1/2 teaspoon almond extract (optional, but makes the flavor outstanding)*", "royal icing or easy cookie glaze icing (see blog post above to read about each)", "gel food coloring", "sanding sugar sprinkles", "mini marshmallows, halved (for bunny tails)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk\u00a0the flour, baking powder, and salt together in a medium bowl. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/easter-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a handheld or a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter and sugar together on high speed until completely smooth and creamy, about 3 minutes. (Here\u2019s a helpful tutorial if you need guidance on\u00a0how to cream butter and sugar.) Add the egg, vanilla, and almond extract (if using) and beat on high speed until combined, about 1 minute. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl and beat again as needed to combine.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/easter-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix on low speed until combined. Dough will be a bit soft. If the dough seems too soft and sticky for rolling, add 1 more Tablespoon of flour.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/easter-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Divide the dough into 2 equal parts. Place each portion onto a piece of lightly floured parchment paper or a lightly floured silicone baking mat. With a lightly floured rolling pin, roll the dough out to about 1/4-inch thickness. Use more flour if the dough seems too sticky. The rolled-out dough can be any shape, as long as it is evenly 1/4-inch thick.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/easter-cookies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Lightly dust one of the rolled-out dough portions with flour. Place a piece of parchment paper on top. (This prevents sticking.) Place the 2nd rolled-out dough on top. Cover with plastic wrap or aluminum foil, then refrigerate for at least 1\u20132 hours and up to 2 days.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/easter-cookies/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once chilled, preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Line 2 or 3 large baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats. Carefully remove the top dough piece from the refrigerator. If it\u2019s sticking to the bottom, run your hand under it to help remove it. Using a cookie cutter, cut the dough into shapes. I used an egg cookie cutter, bunny cookie cutters, and the carrot from this set.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/easter-cookies/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Re-roll the remaining dough and continue cutting until all is used. Repeat with 2nd piece of dough. (Note: It doesn\u2019t seem like a lot of dough, but you get a lot of cookies from the dough scraps you re-roll.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/easter-cookies/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Arrange cookies on baking sheets 3 inches apart. Bake for 11\u201312 minutes or until lightly browned around the edges. If your oven has hot spots, rotate the baking sheets halfway through bake time. Allow cookies to cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely before decorating.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/easter-cookies/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Prepare\u00a0royal icing or cookie glaze icing. If you&#8217;re using royal icing, it&#8217;s best to use piping bags and tips. If you&#8217;re using the cookie glaze icing, you can use a squeeze bottle or piping bags/tips. Keep in mind that if you want sharp design detail on the Easter eggs, it&#8217;s best to use royal icing and piping bags/tips.", "name": "Decorate", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/easter-cookies/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Keep most of the icing white for the bunnies and carrot tops, and tint some orange for the carrots.\u00a0Using icing tip #4 or a squeeze bottle, outline and flood the bunnies and the carrot tops with white icing. Immediately top with sanding sugar sprinkles. And, for the bunnies, add a halved marshmallow &#8220;tail&#8221; while the icing is still wet. If making the carrot cookies, outline and flood the orange icing after applying the green sprinkles on the carrot tops. Allow icing to set. No need to cover the decorated cookies as you wait for the icing to set. If it&#8217;s helpful, decorate the cookies directly on a baking sheet so you can place the entire baking sheet in the refrigerator to help speed up the icing setting. Royal icing sets within about 2 hours, and cookie glaze icing sets in about 24 hours.\u00a0", "name": "For the carrots and bunnies", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/easter-cookies/#instruction-step-10"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Divide icing up among a few bowls. I used 4 colors: sky blue, lemon yellow, violet, and fuchsia. I left some icing white. Using icing tip #4, outline and flood with your base color(s). Allow icing to set (I place the cookies in the refrigerator so the icing sets in about 30 minutes). Using piping tip #2\u00a0or piping tip #1, add decorative designs in different colors like polka dots, squiggles, plaid, or stripes. Allow icing to set. No need to cover the decorated cookies as you wait for the icing to set. If it&#8217;s helpful, decorate the cookies directly on a baking sheet so you can place the entire baking sheet in the refrigerator to help speed up the icing setting. Royal icing sets within about 2 hours.", "name": "For the Easter eggs", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/easter-cookies/#instruction-step-11"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Enjoy cookies right away or wait until the icing sets to serve them. Baking times differ.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "muffins, chocolate chip muffins", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/01/bakery-style-chocolate-chip-muffins-2-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/01/bakery-style-chocolate-chip-muffins-2-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/01/bakery-style-chocolate-chip-muffins-2-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/01/bakery-style-chocolate-chip-muffins-2.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/bakery-style-chocolate-chip-muffins/", "recipeIngredient": ["3 cups (375g)\u00a0all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled)", "3 teaspoons\u00a0baking powder", "1/2 teaspoon baking soda", "1/2 teaspoon\u00a0salt", "1 teaspoon ground cinnamon", "1/8 teaspoon ground nutmeg (optional)", "1/3 cup\u00a0(5 Tablespoons; 71g) unsalted butter, melted and slightly cooled", "1/3 cup\u00a0(80ml)\u00a0vegetable oil*", "1 cup\u00a0(200g)\u00a0granulated sugar", "2\u00a0large\u00a0eggs, at room temperature", "1/3 cup\u00a0(80g)\u00a0sour cream\u00a0or\u00a0yogurt, at room temperature*", "1 cup (240ml)\u00a0milk, at room temperature*", "1 teaspoon\u00a0pure vanilla extract", "1 and 1/2 cups (270g) semi-sweet chocolate chips*", "optional: coarse sugar for sprinkling"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 425\u00b0F (218\u00b0C). Avoid overmixing. The batter will be thick. Sprinkle with coarse sugar (for added crunch, recommended!). Bake it, cool completely, then cover the top with a layer of plastic wrap then a layer of aluminum foil. Freeze for up to 3 months. Thaw in the refrigerator overnight, remove the plastic wrap, cover with just aluminum foil, and then reheat in a 300\u00b0F (149\u00b0C) oven for around 20 minutes. For best results, make the butter rum sauce fresh. (Light colored helps you determine when the butter begins browning.) Melt the butter over medium heat, stirring occasionally. Once melted, the butter will begin to foam. Keep stirring occasionally. After 5-8 minutes, the butter will begin browning\u2014you&#8217;ll notice lightly browned specks begin to form at the bottom of the pan and it will have a nutty aroma. Once browned, remove from heat immediately and pour into a shallow bowl. Each bite is buttery, rich, and loaded with toffee-like flavor\u2014like the best parts of butterscotch pudding wrapped up in cupcake form. Take your time making the butterscotch sauce and don't skip the lemon juice. You can choose your own frosting, such as vanilla buttercream (pictured) or\u00a0Swiss meringue buttercream. Other options include not-so-sweet whipped frosting\u00a0or light and fluffy whipped cream.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "brown sugar butterscotch cupcakes", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/11/butterscotch-filled-brown-sugar-cupcakes-2-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/11/butterscotch-filled-brown-sugar-cupcakes-2-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/11/butterscotch-filled-brown-sugar-cupcakes-2-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/11/butterscotch-filled-brown-sugar-cupcakes-2.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-sugar-butterscotch-cupcakes/", "recipeIngredient": ["1/4 cup (4 Tbsp; 56g) unsalted butter", "3/4 cup (150g) dark brown sugar", "1/2 teaspoon fresh lemon juice (do not skip!)", "1/2 cup (120g/ml) heavy cream (do not use milk or half-and-half)", "2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract\u00a0(or vanilla bean paste)", "2 teaspoons scotch, bourbon, or rum (see Note)", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "1 and 2/3 cups (209g) all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled)", "1 teaspoon baking powder", "1/4 teaspoon baking soda", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "1/2 cup (8 Tbsp; 113g) unsalted butter, melted and slightly cooled", "1 cup (200g) packed light or dark brown sugar", "1 large egg, at room temperature", "1/4 cup (60g) sour cream or plain yogurt, at room temperature", "3/4 cup (180g/ml) whole milk, at room temperature", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract\u00a0(or vanilla bean paste)", "Vanilla buttercream (sweet) or Swiss meringue buttercream (not as sweet)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter with the brown sugar and lemon juice, whisking to combine. Once melted and combined, slowly pour in the heavy cream, whisking constantly. Once the cream has been incorporated, stop whisking and let the mixture come to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low and let boil for 3\u20134 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla extract, scotch (if using), and salt. Allow to cool completely. This makes a little over 1 cup of butterscotch sauce, or about 250g.", "name": "Make the butterscotch sauce", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/brown-sugar-butterscotch-cupcakes/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Line a 12-cup muffin pan with cupcake liners. Line a second pan with 3 liners\u2014this recipe makes about 15 cupcakes. (Usually you can fit between 1\u20132 teaspoons of filling in each; you will have butterscotch sauce leftover to drizzle on top of the frosting.) Slice/tear off the pointy end of the \u201ccone\u201d piece of cupcake you removed, and gently press the round piece back on top of the filling. If the dough keeps shrinking back as you try to stretch it, stop what you&#8217;re doing, cover it lightly for 5-10 minutes, then try again. There is art (and science!) to truffle making.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/dark-chocolate-key-lime-pie-truffles/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Heat the cream and lime zest in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir it until the mixture barely comes to a boil. Remove from heat and allow the lime flavor to infuse the cream for 30 minutes.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/dark-chocolate-key-lime-pie-truffles/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, place the chopped white chocolate into a medium heatproof bowl.\u00a0Add the lime juice and butter to the bowl. Do not stir yet. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/dark-chocolate-key-lime-pie-truffles/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "After 30 minutes, place the lime-infused cream back over heat until it barely begins simmering again. Remove from heat and strain it through a mesh sieve overtop the white chocolate, to remove the zest. Gently begin stirring the white chocolate mixture with a rubber spatula in one direction. Do not forcefully stir it\u2014use gentle, circular motions. Once all of the white chocolate is completely smooth, cover with a piece of plastic wrap pressed onto the top of the ganache filling. Let it sit at room temperature for 1 hour, then transfer to the refrigerator for 5\u20136 more hours. Overnight is OK.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/dark-chocolate-key-lime-pie-truffles/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "After chilling, the ganache filling will be smooth and a little soft, but still manageable to scoop by hand. Set aside. Make sure you have enough room in your refrigerator for the baking sheets because the truffles must chill after being rolled in the next step.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/dark-chocolate-key-lime-pie-truffles/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Measure 1 teaspoon of ganache filling and roll between your hands into a ball. Place on the prepared baking sheet. I like to wipe my hands clean with a paper towel between each truffle rolling. Clean hands make rolling the sticky truffles easier. Repeat rolling remaining truffles. Refrigerate the truffles as you melt the chocolate coating.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/dark-chocolate-key-lime-pie-truffles/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the bittersweet chocolate in a medium heat-proof bowl. I like to use a liquid measuring cup. Its depth makes it easier for dipping the truffles. Melt in 30-second increments in the microwave, stirring after each increment until completely melted and smooth. Let the warm chocolate sit for 5 minutes to slightly cool before dipping. Alternatively, you can temper the chocolate. If tempering, do not store finished truffles in the refrigerator.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/dark-chocolate-key-lime-pie-truffles/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove truffles from the refrigerator and begin dipping into the chocolate using the dipping tool suggested below this recipe. Alternatively, you can use a spoon, fork, toothpick, etc. The dipping tools make the process 100x easier, quicker, and your truffles will look better! Place the dipped truffles back onto the baking sheets. \u00a0Melt the white chocolate and candy melts (if using) together in the same manner you melted the chocolate in step 8. Using a fork or a squeeze bottle, drizzle over the truffles.\u00a0Allow truffles\u00a0to set at room temperature for at least 1 hour.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/dark-chocolate-key-lime-pie-truffles/#instruction-step-9"}], "prepTime": "PT1H30M", "cookTime": "", "totalTime": "PT8H30M", "recipeYield": ["60", "60 truffles"], "recipeCategory": "Candy", "cookingMethod": "No Bake", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "5", "ratingValue": "4.6"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sidney Tucker"}, "datePublished": "2023-11-19", "reviewBody": "These were ugly, because I did not have the correct dipping utensils, but DIVINE!!! Add the butter, 1 Tablespoon at a time, pulsing a few times after each addition. Add the egg and pulse only until the dough comes together in a clump. The dough should be soft. Transfer it to a lightly floured surface and press it into a 1-inch-thick disc. *If you don&#8217;t have a food processor, use a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment. Beat the dry ingredients together, and then beat in the butter on medium speed 1 Tablespoon at a time, and then beat in the egg.*", "name": "Make the crust", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/fresh-fruit-tart-vanilla-mascarpone-cream/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the soft dough in the prepared pan and use your hands to press it evenly into the pan and up the sides. It may seem like you don\u2019t have enough dough at first, but keep pressing. Use the bottom of a metal measuring cup to press the edges firmly against the rim of the pan. Flatten the top edge so it\u2019s even with the rim of the pan, or use a paring knife to trim. Save the scraps to patch up any thin-looking areas. Prick the bottom of the crust all over with a fork. Cover and freeze for at least 30 minutes or up to 1 day.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/fresh-fruit-tart-vanilla-mascarpone-cream/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). In a small bowl using a fork, gently mix the mascarpone with the remaining confectioners&#8217; sugar. Don&#8217;t over-mix; you only want to smooth out the mascarpone here. (Here\u2019s a helpful tutorial if you need guidance on\u00a0how to cream butter and sugar.) Add the egg and vanilla extract, and then beat on high speed until combined. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed.", "name": "Make the cookies", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-frosted-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a separate bowl, whisk the flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt together until combined. With the mixer running on low speed, slowly pour into the wet ingredients. Beat on low speed until combined. The cookie dough will be thick and sticky. Cover dough tightly and chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours and up to 3 days. Chilling is mandatory for this sticky cookie dough.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-frosted-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-frosted-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove cookie dough from the refrigerator. (If the cookie dough chilled longer than 3 hours, let it sit at room temperature for about 20 minutes. This makes the chilled cookie dough easier to scoop and roll.) Scoop dough, 1 heaping Tablespoon (about 28\u201330g) of dough each, and roll into balls, and arrange 2\u20133 inches apart on the baking sheets.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-frosted-cookies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake the cookies for 12\u201313 minutes or until the edges appear set. Tip: If they aren\u2019t really spreading by minute 10, remove them from the oven and lightly bang the baking sheet on the counter 2\u20133x. This helps initiate that spread. Return to the oven to continue baking.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-frosted-cookies/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cool cookies for 10 minutes on the baking sheet, then transfer cookies to a cooling rack to cool completely.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-frosted-cookies/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "With a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle or whisk attachment, beat the butter on medium speed until creamy, about 2 minutes. Add confectioners&#8217; sugar, cocoa powder, heavy cream/milk, vanilla extract, and salt. Beat on low speed for 30 seconds, then increase to high speed and beat for 1 full minute. Taste. In you want a larger lemon pound cake in a Bundt pan, here are 2 options: (1) Double the recipe, but use 3/4 cup (180g) of sour cream to ensure there is enough moisture. The rest of the ingredients are simply doubled. Follow the same baking time and temperature from my <a href=\"https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/cream-cheese-pound-cake/\">cream cheese pound cake</a>. And (2) Use my <a href=\"https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/glazed-lemon-poppy-seed-bundt-cake/\">lemon poppy seed Bundt cake</a> recipe, and feel free to skip the poppy seeds.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/iced-lemon-pound-cake/#faq-question-1706557759158", "position": 2, "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/iced-lemon-pound-cake/#faq-question-1706557759158", "name": "Can I add blueberries?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Absolutely. You can fold 1 cup (about 140g) of fresh blueberries into the batter. I try to avoid frozen blueberries because they turn the batter and cake grayish blue, but feel free to use them if that's all you have. No need to coat them with flour before folding in, but feel free to do so if you'd like. This batter is quite thick, so they don't really sink.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "Iced Lemon Pound Cake", "description": "Dense, buttery pound cake gets a lemon lift in this bright and cheery citrus version. Iced lemon pound cake is super moist and bursting with the flavors of fresh lemon, creamy butter, and sweet vanilla. A creamy lemon icing that sets on top is the only decorating this small-yet-stunning cake requires.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "lemon pound cake", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/lemon-loaf-pound-cake-4-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/lemon-loaf-pound-cake-4-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/lemon-loaf-pound-cake-4-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/lemon-loaf-pound-cake-4.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/iced-lemon-pound-cake/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 and 1/2 cups (188g) all-purpose flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled)", "1 and 1/2 teaspoons baking powder", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "1 cup (16 Tbsp; 226g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "1 cup (200g) granulated sugar", "3 large\u00a0eggs, at room temperature", "1/4 cup (60g) sour cream, at room temperature", "1 teaspoon lemon zest", "3 Tablespoons (45ml) freshly squeezed lemon juice (about 1 lemon)", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "1 cup (120g) confectioners&#8217; sugar, sifted", "1 and 1/2 Tablespoons (22ml) lemon juice", "1 Tablespoon (15ml) heavy cream or milk (heavy cream produces a thick icing as pictured)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Lower the oven rack to the lower-third position and preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Grease an 8&#215;4-inch loaf pan (like this one or this one) with nonstick spray. Or you can use a 9&#215;5-inch loaf pan for a shorter loaf.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/iced-lemon-pound-cake/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "\u00a0Whisk the flour, baking powder, and salt together in a large bowl. Set aside.", "name": "Make the cake", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/iced-lemon-pound-cake/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "With a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle or whisk attachment, beat the butter on high speed in a large bowl until smooth and creamy, about 1 minute. Add the granulated sugar and beat on high speed for 2 minutes until creamed. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. (Here\u2019s a helpful tutorial if you need guidance on\u00a0how to cream butter and sugar.) With the mixer running on low speed, add the eggs one at a time. Once the last egg is completely mixed in, stop the mixer. Add the sour cream, lemon juice, lemon zest, and vanilla extract, then beat on medium speed until combined. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. The mixture may look curdled as a result of the varying textures combining. This is normal and the batter will come together when you add the dry ingredients in the next step.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/iced-lemon-pound-cake/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "With the mixer running on low speed, slowly add the dry ingredients just until combined. If needed, run a whisk through the batter a few times to rid any large lumps. Avoid over-mixing. Batter is very thick.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/iced-lemon-pound-cake/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spoon/spread the batter into prepared loaf pan and bake for 55-65 minutes if you used an 8&#215;4-inch pan and 45-60 minutes if you used a 9&#215;5-inch loaf pan. Tent the cake with aluminum foil halfway through baking to prevent the top from over-browning. Pound cakes are dense and take awhile to bake in the oven. Baking times vary, so keep an eye on yours and don&#8217;t be alarmed if yours is taking longer. The cake is done when a toothpick inserted in the center comes out *mostly* clean. A couple moist crumbs are OK.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/iced-lemon-pound-cake/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the cake from the oven and place on a wire rack. You can add the icing while the cake is still warm or wait for it to cool.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/iced-lemon-pound-cake/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk all of the icing ingredients together and pour over cake. leveled)", "1 teaspoon salt", "2 teaspoons baking powder", "3/4 teaspoon baking soda", "1 and 1/2 cups (340g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "2 cups (400g) granulated sugar", "5 large eggs, at room temperature", "1/3 cup (75g) sour cream, at room temperature", "1 Tablespoon pure vanilla extract (yes, Tbsp!)", "1 and 3/4 cups (420ml) buttermilk, at room temperature", "2 Tablespoons milk or buttermilk, warmed", "1 teaspoon espresso powder (optional)", "1/3 cup (27g)\u00a0unsweetened natural or dutch-process cocoa powder", "2 Tablespoons granulated sugar", "12 ounces (339g) full-fat brick cream cheese,\u00a0softened to room temperature*", "3/4 cup (12 Tbsp; 170g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "3 and 1/2 cups (420g) confectioners&#8217; sugar", "2/3 cup (55g) unsweetened natural or dutch-process cocoa powder", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "1-2 Tablespoons milk or heavy cream", "pinch salt", "sprinkles for decorating, if desired"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C).\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/zebra-cake/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the flour, salt, baking powder, and baking soda together in a large bowl. Set aside. Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter and sugar together on high speed until smooth and creamy, about 3 minutes. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl with a silicone spatula as needed. Add the eggs and mix on medium speed until combined. Scrape down the bowl again, and then beat in the sour cream and vanilla extract. The batter will look lumpy and curdled; that&#8217;s normal at this point.", "name": "Make the vanilla batter", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/zebra-cake/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add about 1/3 of the dry ingredients and 1/3 of the buttermilk, then beat on low speed until combined. Add another 1/3 of the dry ingredients and 1/3 of the buttermilk, then beat again on low speed until combined. Add the remaining of each, and beat just until incorporated. Do not over-mix this batter. The batter will be smooth, velvety, and slightly thick.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/zebra-cake/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "There will be around 8 cups of batter total. Divide it in half (you can just eyeball it) and transfer half of the batter into another bowl. Whisk espresso powder into the warmed milk and then add it to one of the batters, along with the cocoa powder and sugar. Whisk until combined; a few small lumps are OK.", "name": "Make the chocolate batter", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/zebra-cake/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Grease three 9-inch round cake pans, line with parchment paper rounds, then grease the parchment paper. Parchment paper helps the cakes seamlessly release from the pans. (If it&#8217;s helpful, see this parchment paper rounds for cakes video &amp; post.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/zebra-cake/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Drop a large spoonful of 1 batter in the center of each pan. You can use the back of the spoon to spread it around a bit to make a circle. Top each circle with a spoonful of the other batter. Rotating the pans as you add the batters will help you get that circle shape. Alternate spoonfuls of the batters on top of each other in each pan and repeat until all the batter is used. After every few spoonfuls, give the pans a little shake to level out the batters.\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/zebra-cake/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 25\u201327 minutes, or until the cakes are baked through. To test for doneness, insert a toothpick into the center of the cake. If it comes out clean, it is done. Allow the cakes to cool in the pans set on a cooling rack for 1 hour, then remove them from the pans and let the cakes finish cooling directly on the rack. The cakes must be completely cool before frosting and assembling.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/zebra-cake/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle or whisk attachment, beat the cream cheese on high speed until completely smooth and creamy, about 1 minute. Scrape down the sides of the bowl. Add the butter and beat until combined. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl with a silicone spatula as needed. Add the confectioners&#8217; sugar, cocoa powder, vanilla extract, 1 Tablespoon milk, and salt and beat on low speed; gradually increase the speed to medium-high and beat until combined and creamy. Add 1 more Tablespoon of milk to slightly thin out, if needed. Taste, then add another pinch of salt if desired.", "name": "Make the frosting", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/zebra-cake/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "First, using a large serrated knife, slice a thin layer off the tops of the cakes to create a flat surface. Discard (or crumble over ice cream!). Place 1 cake layer on your cake stand, cake turntable, or serving plate. Evenly cover the top with about 1 cup of frosting (about 240g). Top with the 2nd cake layer, upside down, and evenly cover the top with the same amount of frosting. Top with the 3rd cake layer. Spread the remaining frosting in a thick layer all over the top and around the sides. Garnish with sprinkles, if desired. Refrigerate for at least 45 minutes before slicing. This helps the cake keep its shape when cutting\u2014it could slightly fall apart without this time in the fridge.", "name": "Assemble and frost:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/zebra-cake/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover leftover cake tightly and store in the refrigerator for up to 5 days. Soft, chewy, and easy to make! Don\u2019t forget to place the cookies in the freezer for 10 minutes to prevent the candy from melting.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "candy cane kiss cookies", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/candy-cane-kiss-christmas-cookies-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/candy-cane-kiss-christmas-cookies-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/candy-cane-kiss-christmas-cookies-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/candy-cane-kiss-christmas-cookies.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/candy-cane-kiss-cookies/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 cups + 1 Tablespoon (260g) all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled)", "1 and 1/2 teaspoons baking powder", "1/4 teaspoon salt", "10 Tablespoons (142g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "1 cup (200g) granulated sugar", "1 large egg, at room temperature", "1 teaspoon vanilla extract", "1/4 teaspoon peppermint extract*", "1/2 cup (about 90g) nonpareil sprinkles (I use these)", "32\u201336 candy cane flavor Hershey&#8217;s Kisses, unwrapped"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the flour, baking powder, and salt together in a medium bowl until combined. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/candy-cane-kiss-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a hand-held or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter and sugar together on high speed until creamy and combined, about 3 minutes. (Here\u2019s a helpful tutorial if you need guidance on\u00a0how to cream butter and sugar.) Add the egg, vanilla extract, and peppermint extract and beat until combined, about 1 minute. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl and beat again as needed to combine.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/candy-cane-kiss-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the flour mixture to the wet ingredients and mix on low speed until fully combined. The dough will be very thick.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/candy-cane-kiss-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Roll dough into balls, 1 scant Tablespoon of dough each (each dough ball should weigh about 20g). The dough may seem dry, but the warmth of your hands will allow it to come together in a ball. Roll each dough ball generously in the sprinkles. If the sprinkles are not sticking to the dough balls, the dough may be too firm. Try pouring the sprinkles onto a plate and pressing the dough balls into the sprinkles. Or continue rolling the dough balls, as the warmth from your hands can help get the sprinkles to stick. If this still isn&#8217;t helping, beat 1 teaspoon of water into the dough to help make it a bit stickier, and then try again.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/candy-cane-kiss-cookies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place sprinkled dough balls on a baking sheet or plate (whatever will fit in your refrigerator). Chill them in the refrigerator for 20 minutes, and up to 1 day. If chilling for longer than 1 hour, cover them.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/candy-cane-kiss-cookies/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "While the cookie dough balls are chilling, preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/candy-cane-kiss-cookies/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the chilled dough balls about 2 inches apart on the lined baking sheets. Bake for 12 minutes or until edges appear set. The cookies may look under-baked in the centers; that&#8217;s ok\u2014do not over-bake. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed.", "name": "Make the cookies", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-thin-mint-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Sift the flour and cocoa powder together in a medium bowl. Roll each portion out onto a piece of parchment to about 1/4\u2033 thickness. Stack the pieces (with parchment paper between)\u00a0onto a baking sheet and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Chilling is mandatory. If chilling for more than a couple hours, cover the top dough piece with a\u00a0single\u00a0piece of parchment paper. You can chill up to 2 days.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-thin-mint-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once chilled, preheat oven to\u00a0350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Re-roll the remaining dough and continue cutting until all is used.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-thin-mint-cookies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 8-10 minutes or until the edges appear set. The cookies will seem very soft in the centers. Make sure you rotate the baking sheet halfway through bake time. Cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely before dipping in chocolate.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/homemade-thin-mint-cookies/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Melt the chopped chocolate and oil together in a double boiler or (carefully!) use the microwave. For the microwave, place the chocolate and oil in a medium heat-proof bowl. Melt in 15 second increments, stirring after each increment until completely melted and smooth. Once melted, stir in the peppermint extract. Dip each cooled cookie completely into the chocolate and use a fork to lift out. Tap the fork gently on the side of the bowl to allow excess chocolate to drip off. Place cookie onto a parchment or silicone baking mat-lined baking sheet. Place the baking sheet into the refrigerator to help the chocolate set. The recipe walks you through each step and includes make-ahead and freezing instructions in the Notes below.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally McKenney", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "oatmeal molasses dinner rolls", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/11/oatmeal-molasses-dinner-rolls-3-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/11/oatmeal-molasses-dinner-rolls-3-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/11/oatmeal-molasses-dinner-rolls-3-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/11/oatmeal-molasses-dinner-rolls-3.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/oatmeal-molasses-dinner-rolls/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 cup (240g/ml) water, warmed to about 110\u00b0F (43\u00b0C)", "1/3 cup (80g/ml) whole milk, warmed to about 110\u00b0F (43\u00b0C)", "1 Tablespoon (9g) Platinum Yeast from Red Star instant yeast", "3 Tablespoons light or dark brown sugar, divided", "3 Tablespoons (64g) molasses", "4 Tablespoons (56g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature and cut into 4 pieces", "1 cup (85g) old-fashioned whole rolled oats, plus more for topping the rolls", "3 and 1/2 cups (455g) bread flour (spooned &amp; leveled), plus more as needed", "1 teaspoon salt", "egg wash: 1 egg white beaten with 1 teaspoon of water"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the warm water, milk, yeast, and 1 Tablespoon of the brown sugar together in the bowl of your stand mixer. Cover and allow to sit for 5\u201310 minutes, until foamy and frothy on top. *If you do not own a stand mixer, you can do this in a large mixing bowl and in the next step, mix the dough together with a large wooden spoon/silicone spatula. It will take a bit of arm muscle. A hand mixer works, but the sticky dough repeatedly gets stuck in the beaters. Mixing by hand with a wooden spoon or silicone spatula is a better choice.*", "name": "Prepare the dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/oatmeal-molasses-dinner-rolls/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the remaining brown sugar (2 Tablespoons), the molasses, butter, oats, salt, and 1 cup of bread flour. With a dough hook or paddle attachment, mix/beat on low speed for 1 minute, stop and scrape down the sides of the bowl with a silicone spatula, then add the remaining 2 and 1/2 cups of flour. Beat on medium speed until the dough comes together and pulls away from the sides of the bowl, about 2 minutes. If the dough seems too wet to a point where kneading (next step) would be impossible, beat in more flour 1 Tablespoon at a time until you have a workable dough, similar to the photos above. Dough should be soft and a little sticky, but still manageable to knead with lightly floured hands.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/oatmeal-molasses-dinner-rolls/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "\u00a0Keep the dough in the mixer and beat for an additional 5-8 minutes, or knead by hand on a lightly floured surface for 5-8 minutes. (If you\u2019re new to bread-baking, my How to Knead Dough video tutorial can help here.) If the dough becomes too sticky during the kneading process, sprinkle 1 teaspoon of flour at a time on the dough or on the work surface/in the bowl to make a soft, slightly tacky dough. Do not add more flour than you need because you do not want a dry dough. After kneading, the dough should still feel a little soft. Poke it with your finger\u2014if it slowly bounces back, your dough is ready to rise.", "name": "Knead the dough", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/oatmeal-molasses-dinner-rolls/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Lightly grease a large bowl with oil or nonstick spray. Place the dough in the bowl, turning it to coat all sides in the oil. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or a clean kitchen towel. Allow the dough to rise in a relatively warm environment for 1.5\u20132 hours or until double in size. (I always let it rise on the counter. Takes about 2 hours. For a tiny reduction in rise time, see my answer to Where Should Dough Rise? in my Baking with Yeast Guide.)", "name": "1st Rise", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/oatmeal-molasses-dinner-rolls/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Grease a 9&#215;13-inch baking pan or two 9-inch square or round baking pans, or line with parchment paper. You can also bake the rolls in a cast-iron skillet or on a lined baking sheet.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/oatmeal-molasses-dinner-rolls/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "When the dough is ready, punch it down to release the air. Divide the dough into 15 equal pieces, about 68\u201370g each. A kitchen scale is helpful for this step. Shape each piece into a smooth ball. Here is what I usually do: take a piece of dough and stretch the top while pinching and sealing the bottom. Make sure the rolls are smooth on top and sealed on the bottom. Arrange in prepared baking pan.", "name": "Shape the rolls", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/oatmeal-molasses-dinner-rolls/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover shaped rolls with plastic wrap or a clean kitchen towel. Allow to rise until puffy, about 30\u201360 minutes.", "name": "2nd Rise:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/oatmeal-molasses-dinner-rolls/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Adjust oven rack to a lower position and preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). (It&#8217;s best to bake the rolls towards the bottom of the oven so the tops don&#8217;t burn.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/oatmeal-molasses-dinner-rolls/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Gently brush the tops of the risen rolls with egg wash, and lightly sprinkle each with oats. Bake for 26\u201327 minutes or until golden brown on top, rotating the pan halfway through. If you notice the tops browning too quickly, loosely cover the pan with aluminum foil. To ensure they\u2019re fully baked, check the internal temperature with an instant-read thermometer; it should read 190\u00b0F (88\u00b0C).", "name": "Bake the rolls", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/oatmeal-molasses-dinner-rolls/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Allow rolls to cool for a few minutes before serving. Cover leftover rolls tightly and store at room temperature for 2\u20133 days or in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/oatmeal-molasses-dinner-rolls/#instruction-step-10"}], "prepTime": "PT3H25M", "cookTime": "PT26M", "totalTime": "PT3H50M", "recipeYield": ["15", "15 rolls"], "recipeCategory": "Dinner", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "8", "ratingValue": "5"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Keitha Cain"}, "datePublished": "2025-11-26", "reviewBody": "Made these today for thanksgiving dinner tomorrow. This recipe is also in my New York Times best-selling cookbook, Sally's Baking 101.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "maple brown sugar cookies", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/maple-brown-sugar-cookies-3-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/maple-brown-sugar-cookies-3-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/maple-brown-sugar-cookies-3-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/maple-brown-sugar-cookies-3.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/maple-brown-sugar-cookies/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 and 1/3 cups (292g) all-purpose flour (spooned &amp; leveled)", "1 teaspoon baking soda", "1/4 teaspoon salt", "1/2 cup (8 Tbsp; 113g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "1 cup (200g) packed dark brown sugar*", "1 large egg, at room temperature", "1/3 cup (113g/80ml) pure maple syrup*", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "1 teaspoon maple extract*", "1 cup (120g) chopped pecans*", "2 Tablespoons (28g) unsalted butter", "1/3 cup (113g/80ml) pure maple syrup", "1 cup\u00a0(112g) sifted\u00a0confectioners\u2019 sugar*", "pinch of salt, to taste"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium bowl, whisk the flour, baking soda, and salt together. Set aside.", "name": "Make the cookies", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/maple-brown-sugar-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a handheld mixer or a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter and brown sugar on medium-high speed until light and creamy, about 3 minutes. Add the egg and beat on high speed until combined, about 30 seconds. Scrape down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed. Add the maple syrup, vanilla extract, and maple extract, then beat on high speed until combined, about 1 minute. Pour the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients and beat on low speed until combined. Add the pecans and beat on low speed until just incorporated. Dough will be creamy and soft.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/maple-brown-sugar-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover the dough and refrigerate it for at least 2 hours (and up to 3 days).\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/maple-brown-sugar-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Line large baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats. (Always recommended for cookies.) Once the butter has melted, remove from heat and whisk in the sifted confectioners\u2019 sugar and salt. Taste. Drizzle over the cooled cookies. Icing will set after about 1 hour.
