Your best bet is to purchase or pick about 10 firm peaches (about 3 pounds), then let them sit in a paper bag for 1\u20132 days to ripen. Some may have soft spots after this time, so that is why I suggest buying a couple more than you actually need. Eat any overly soft peaches or use them in <a href=\"https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peach-streusel-muffins/\">peach muffins</a>.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peach-pecan-crisp/#faq-question-1688305810683", "position": 2, "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peach-pecan-crisp/#faq-question-1688305810683", "name": "What's the Difference Between Peach Crisp and Peach Cobbler?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "This is a great question, and I definitely want to answer it for anyone wondering. Peach crisp and <a href=\"https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/fresh-peach-cobbler/\">peach cobbler</a> both showcase peaches, but they have different toppings. Peach crisp includes a buttery streusel-like oat crumb topping, while peach cobbler typically has a thicker, more substantial biscuit topping. Both are easier than pie!", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peach-pecan-crisp/#faq-question-1688305761103", "position": 3, "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peach-pecan-crisp/#faq-question-1688305761103", "name": "Can I Use Frozen Peaches in Peach Crisp?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Fresh peaches are best for peach crisp, but you can get away with unsweetened frozen peaches. If using frozen peaches, thaw, chop, and blot them dry before using. Canned peaches are not ideal because they\u2019re already too soft and mushy.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peach-pecan-crisp/#faq-question-1688327754130", "position": 4, "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/peach-pecan-crisp/#faq-question-1688327754130", "name": "Can I Make Peach Crisp Without Oats?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "You can make this peach crisp without oats using most of the same exact ingredients. Use the topping from <a href=\"https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/apple-crumble-pie/\" rel=\"\">apple crumble pie</a>. Don't over-mix\u2014it will become a paste if you over-mix. Use the same oven temperature and bake time as below.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "Perfect Peach Crisp", "description": "This buttery peach crisp combines sweet and juicy peaches with brown sugar cinnamon oat streusel. This banana cake with brown butter cream cheese frosting is loved by all!", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "banana cake, brown butter cream cheese frosting", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/07/banana-cake-brown-butter-cream-cheese-frosting-2-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/07/banana-cake-brown-butter-cream-cheese-frosting-2-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/07/banana-cake-brown-butter-cream-cheese-frosting-2-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/07/banana-cake-brown-butter-cream-cheese-frosting-2.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/banana-cake-with-brown-butter-cream-cheese-frosting/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 and 1/2 cups (345g) mashed bananas (about 4 medium or 3 large ripe bananas)", "3 cups (375g) all-purpose flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled)", "1 teaspoon baking powder", "1 teaspoon baking soda", "1 teaspoon ground cinnamon", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "3/4 cup (12 Tbsp; 170g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "1 cup (200g) granulated sugar", "1/2 cup (100g) packed light or dark brown sugar", "3 large eggs, at room temperature", "2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "1 and 1/2 cups (360ml) buttermilk, at room temperature", "1/2 cup (8 Tbsp; 113g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "12 ounces (339g) full-fat brick cream cheese, softened to room temperature", "4 cups (480g) confectioners&#8217; sugar", "2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "1/2 teaspoon salt"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Grease three 9-inch round cake pans, line with parchment paper rounds, then grease the parchment paper. Parchment paper helps the cakes seamlessly release from the pans. (If it&#8217;s helpful, see this parchment paper rounds for cakes video &amp; post.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/banana-cake-with-brown-butter-cream-cheese-frosting/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "**Time-saving tip** Brown the butter in step 8 now, then place into the refrigerator to solidify as instructed below. This will save time when you&#8217;re ready to make the frosting.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/banana-cake-with-brown-butter-cream-cheese-frosting/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "\u00a0Mash the bananas. I usually just use my mixer for this! Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/banana-cake-with-brown-butter-cream-cheese-frosting/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar together on high speed until smooth and creamy, about 2 minutes. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula as needed.\u00a0Add the eggs\u00a0and the vanilla. Beat on medium-high speed until combined, then beat in the mashed bananas. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. With the mixer on low speed, add the dry ingredients in three additions alternating with the buttermilk and mixing each addition just until incorporated. Do not overmix. The batter will be slightly thick. A few lumps is OK.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/banana-cake-with-brown-butter-cream-cheese-frosting/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Divide batter evenly between 3 pans. The cakes are done when a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/banana-cake-with-brown-butter-cream-cheese-frosting/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the cakes from the oven and set on a wire rack.\u00a0Allow to cool completely in the pan.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/banana-cake-with-brown-butter-cream-cheese-frosting/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Slice the butter up into pieces and place in a light-colored skillet. (Light colored helps you determine when the butter begins browning.) Melt the butter over medium heat, stirring occasionally. Once melted, the butter will begin to foam. Keep stirring occasionally. After 5-8 minutes, the butter will begin browning\u2014you&#8217;ll notice lightly browned specks begin to form at the bottom of the pan and it will have a nutty aroma. See photo above for a visual. Once browned, remove from heat, and immediately pour into a heat-proof bowl. Refrigerate until solid.", "name": "Make the frosting", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/banana-cake-with-brown-butter-cream-cheese-frosting/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large\u00a0bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle or whisk attachment, beat the solid brown butter on high speed until creamed. Add the cream cheese and beat on high\u00a0speed until combined, smooth, and creamy. Add 4 cups confectioners&#8217; sugar, vanilla, and salt. Beat on low speed for 30 seconds, then switch to high speed and beat for 2 minutes. If you want the frosting a little thicker, add the extra 1/4 cup of confectioners sugar.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/banana-cake-with-brown-butter-cream-cheese-frosting/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place 1 cake layer on your cake stand, cake turntable, or serving plate. Evenly cover the top with frosting. Top with 2nd layer and evenly cover the top with frosting. Finish with the third cake layer and spread the remaining frosting all over the top and sides. Garnish with chopped nuts. You&#8217;ll have about 3 cups of filling. Roll into a large 12-inch circle. Use your warm hands to mold any cracking edges back together if needed. From the circle, cut rounds using a 2.5 inch cookie cutter. (Sometimes I use my 1/3 cup measuring cup, which is 2.5 inches in diameter.) You\u2019ll have to re-roll the dough scraps a few times. Work quickly, as the dough becomes much more delicate the longer it&#8217;s at room temperature. You&#8217;ll get about 24 rounds per pie crust. Repeat with 2nd chilled pie dough for a total of about 48.", "name": "Shape the mini crusts", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/mini-pumpkin-pies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the dough rounds into greased 24-count mini muffin pan(s). Allow to cool for 5 minutes before removing from the pan. If greased well, the mini pies pop right out using a spoon to scoop them up. Cool, then serve at room temperature or refrigerate until chilled and serve cold. Filling deflates a bit as they cool. Top with whipped cream if desired. leveled)", "3/4 cup (65g) unsweetened natural cocoa powder*", "1 and 3/4 cups (350g) granulated sugar", "2 teaspoons baking soda", "1 teaspoon baking powder", "1 teaspoon salt", "2 teaspoons espresso powder (optional)*", "1/2 cup (120ml) canola or vegetable oil", "2 large eggs, at room temperature", "3/4 cup (180g) full fat sour cream, at room temperature*", "1/2 cup (120ml) buttermilk, at room temperature*", "2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "1/2 cup (120ml) hot water or coffee*", "2 (15 ounce) cans dark sweet cherries in heavy syrup*", "2 Tablespoons cherry liquor (sold as kirsch or kirschwasser)*", "1 cup (240ml) heavy cream or heavy whipping cream", "two 4-ounce semi-sweet chocolate bars (226g), finely chopped", "optional: 1 Tablespoon light corn syrup*", "2 cups (480ml) cold heavy cream or heavy whipping cream", "1/4 cup (30g) confectioners&#8217; sugar", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Grease three 9-inch cake pans, line with parchment paper rounds, then grease the parchment paper. Parchment paper helps the cakes seamlessly release from the pans. (If it&#8217;s helpful, see this parchment paper rounds for cakes video &amp; post.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/black-forest-cake/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the chocolate cake: Whisk the flour, cocoa powder, sugar, baking soda, baking powder, salt, and espresso powder (if using) together in a large bowl. Set aside. Using a KitchenAid stand mixer fitted with a flat beater, beat the oil, eggs, sour cream, buttermilk, and vanilla together until combined. Pour the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients, add the hot water or coffee, and beat it all until the batter is completely combined.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/black-forest-cake/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Divide batter evenly between 3 pans. Bake for 21-25 minutes. Baking times vary, so keep an eye on yours. The cakes are done when a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove the cakes from the oven and set on a wire rack. Allow to cool for 30 minutes in the pans, then remove cakes from pans and set on a cooling rack. Be careful and use two hands when handling the cakes.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/black-forest-cake/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "After the cakes have cooled, use a large serrated knife or cake leveler to slice a thin layer off the tops of the cakes to create a flat surface. Discard (or crumble over ice cream!).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/black-forest-cake/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Prepare the syrup: Drain the cherries, reserving 3/4 cup (180ml) of the heavy syrup. Set cherries aside. Simmer syrup and cherry liquor in a small saucepan over low heat until reduced down to 1/4 cup (60ml). Brush reduced syrup all over the cakes, reserving any leftover syrup.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/black-forest-cake/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Slice the cherries in half, leaving a few whole cherries for garnish. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/black-forest-cake/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the ganache: Place chopped chocolate and corn syrup, if using, in a medium bowl. Heat the cream in a small saucepan until it begins to gently simmer. (Do not let it come to a rapid boil\u2014that&#8217;s too hot!) Pour over chocolate and let it sit for 2-3 minutes to gently soften the chocolate. Slowly stir until completely combined and chocolate has melted. Set aside to cool for 10 minutes as you prepare the whipped cream.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/black-forest-cake/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the whipped cream: Using a KitchenAid stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, whip the heavy cream, sugar, and vanilla extract on medium-high speed until medium peaks form, about 4 minutes. Medium peaks will hold their shape but the tip will gently curl when you lift the whisk.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/black-forest-cake/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Assemble the cake: Place 1 cake layer on your cake stand, cake turntable, or serving plate. Spread 1 heaping cup of whipped cream evenly on top. Dot with half of the halved cherries and drizzle with a spoonful of reduced syrup. Top with 2nd cake layer and evenly cover the top with 1 heaping cup whipped cream, the remaining halved cherries, and another drizzle of reduced syrup. Top with the 3rd cake layer. Spread the remaining whipped cream on top and all around the sides in a thin layer using an icing spatula. Use a bench scraper to smooth out the whipped cream on the sides of the cake.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/black-forest-cake/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour chocolate ganache on top of the cake. Spread to the edges of cake allowing it to gently drip down the sides. Top with whole cherries. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before slicing and serving.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/black-forest-cake/#instruction-step-10"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover and store leftover cake at room temperature for 1 day or in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/black-forest-cake/#instruction-step-11"}], "prepTime": "PT1H20M", "cookTime": "PT25M", "totalTime": "PT3H45M", "recipeYield": ["12", "12 servings"], "recipeCategory": "Cake", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "242", "ratingValue": "4.8"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Lara"}, "datePublished": "2025-12-10", "reviewBody": "Have made this several times for Father's Day, and the dads were fighting over the leftovers! To get enough fruit flavor, use strawberries when they are in season.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "strawberry cheesecake pie", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/strawberry-cheesecake-pie-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/strawberry-cheesecake-pie-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/strawberry-cheesecake-pie-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/strawberry-cheesecake-pie.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-cheesecake-pie/", "recipeIngredient": ["1/2 cup (50g) crushed pretzel crumbs (from 1 cup salted mini pretzel twists or pretzel pieces)", "1 cup (120g) graham cracker crumbs (about 8 full sheet graham crackers)", "3 Tablespoons (37g) granulated sugar", "5 Tablespoons (71g)\u00a0unsalted butter, melted", "1.5 lbs. (about 680g) strawberries, rinsed &amp; hulled", "1 cup\u00a0(240ml) cold\u00a0heavy cream\u00a0or\u00a0heavy whipping cream", "16 ounces (452g) full-fat brick cream cheese, softened to room temperature", "1 cup (120g) confectioners&#8217; sugar", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "1 cup (about 150g) sliced strawberries", "2 Tablespoons + 1 teaspoon (29g) granulated sugar, divided", "1 cup\u00a0(240ml) cold\u00a0heavy cream\u00a0or\u00a0heavy whipping cream", "1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-cheesecake-pie/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Use a food processor or blender to grind the pretzels and graham crackers into a fine crumb. (Or crush both in a zipped top bag with a rolling pin.) Mix the crumbs, granulated sugar, and melted butter together in a medium bowl until combined. The mixture will be thick, coarse, and sandy. Press the mixture into the bottom and up the sides of a 9-inch pie dish. Make sure it is very tight and compact. Use the bottom of a flat measuring cup to press it down tightly. Bake the crust for 15-16 minutes. Remove from the oven and allow to cool for at least 30 minutes (and up to 2 days) before adding the filling. Meanwhile, prep the reduced strawberry puree in the next step.", "name": "Crust", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-cheesecake-pie/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Puree the strawberries completely. You will have 1.5 &#8211; 2 cups puree&#8211; anywhere around this amount is fine. Strain through a fine mesh sieve, using a spoon to press it down and work it through the strainer. Discard seeds. Stirring occasionally, simmer the strained puree over low-medium heat until you&#8217;re left with 1/2 cup or a little over 1/2 cup. This takes at least 25-35 minutes, but could take longer depending on your pan or how juicy your strawberries were. *Do not add sugar or anything to the puree or reduced puree\u2014it&#8217;s just pure strawberries. Allow to cool completely to room temperature before using in the filling. (See make ahead instructions below if doing this in advance.)", "name": "Strawberries for the filling", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-cheesecake-pie/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a hand mixer or a stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, whip the cold heavy cream into stiff peaks on medium-high speed, about 4 minutes. Set aside. Using a hand mixer or a stand mixer fitted with a whisk or paddle attachment, beat the cream cheese on medium speed until perfectly smooth and creamy. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a rubber spatula as needed. Add the cooled reduced strawberry puree, confectioners\u2019 sugar, and vanilla extract and beat on medium-high speed until combined, creamy, and smooth. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed to help combine. Make sure there are no large lumps of cream cheese. If there are lumps, keep beating until smooth.", "name": "Rest of the filling", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-cheesecake-pie/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using your mixer on low speed or a rubber spatula, fold the whipped cream into the cheesecake filling until combined. This takes several turns of your rubber spatula. Combine slowly as you don\u2019t want to deflate all the air in the whipped cream.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-cheesecake-pie/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spread filling into cooled crust. Use a small offset spatula to smooth down the top.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-cheesecake-pie/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover tightly with plastic wrap or aluminum foil and refrigerate for at least 8 hours and up to 2 days. For best results, at least 12 hours is best. The longer refrigerated, the nicer the no-bake cheesecake will set up. I don\u2019t recommend using the freezer to set this cheesecake filling.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-cheesecake-pie/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "About 10-15 minutes before slicing and serving, prepare the toppings. Stir the sliced strawberries and 1 teaspoon (4g) of granulated sugar together. Set aside as you prepare the whipped cream topping. Using a hand mixer or a stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, whip the heavy cream, remaining sugar, and vanilla extract on medium-high speed until medium peaks form, about 3-4 minutes. Medium peaks are between soft/loose peaks and stiff peaks and are the perfect consistency for topping and piping on desserts.", "name": "Toppings", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-cheesecake-pie/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove pie from the refrigerator. Spoon strawberries on pie and pipe whipped cream around the edges. (I used Ateco 849 piping tip.) Or you can serve each individual slice with strawberries and a dollop of whipped cream.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-cheesecake-pie/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a clean sharp knife, cut into slices for serving. For neat slices, wipe the knife clean between each slice.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-cheesecake-pie/#instruction-step-10"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover and store leftover cheesecake in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-cheesecake-pie/#instruction-step-11"}], "prepTime": "PT1H", "cookTime": "PT15M", "totalTime": "PT9H15M", "recipeYield": ["10", "serves 10-12"], "recipeCategory": "Dessert", "cookingMethod": "Mixing", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "26", "ratingValue": "4.5"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "Strawberry Cheesecake Pie | Sally's Baking Addiction", "description": "This strawberry cheesecake pie combines an extraordinarily creamy no-bake strawberry cheesecake filling with a crunchy, salty and sweet pretzel graham cracker crust. We\u2019re adding real strawberries without any artificial flavoring. To get enough fruit flavor, puree then reduce the strawberries down. It\u2019s an extra step, but completely worth it. \n\nGet the full recipe: https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/strawberry-cheesecake-pie/\n\n\u2022 Ask your recipe question or leave a review over on the recipe page.\n\n#baking #recipes #strawberrycheesecakepie\n\n\u2022 More of our favorite recipes: https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/", "duration": "PT2M", "embedUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/NnGzOnXjfRs?feature=oembed", "contentUrl": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NnGzOnXjfRs", "thumbnailUrl": ["https://i.ytimg.com/vi/NnGzOnXjfRs/hqdefault.jpg"], "uploadDate": "2021-07-21T14:10:23+00:00"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Ingrid"}, "datePublished": "2022-06-27", "reviewBody": "Excellent recipe! Very light and not too sweet. I cut the recipe in half and made 12 mini cheesecakes. I did a standard graham cracker crust. I stabilized the whip cream on top with a bit of gelatin. Next time I will add a bit of gelatin to the whipped cream that goes in the filling as well to make a bit firmer.  And next time I might switch to an oreo crust since I love chocolate and strawberry together.  Another fabulous Sally recipe!"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "4"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Colleen C."}, "datePublished": "2023-01-14", "reviewBody": "Hi, the recipe was fabulous. Line two large baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-whoopie-pies-with-salted-caramel-frosting/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt together.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-whoopie-pies-with-salted-caramel-frosting/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a hand-held or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter for 1 minute on medium-high speed until completely smooth and creamy. Add the brown sugar and beat on medium high speed until fluffy and combined. Beat\u00a0in the egg and vanilla on high speed, scraping down the sides and bottom of the bowl as needed to combine.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-whoopie-pies-with-salted-caramel-frosting/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "On low speed, add half of the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients. Then add half of the buttermilk. Repeat with the remaining dry ingredients and buttermilk until everything is added. Beat on medium speed until combined. It will be a thick, tacky, and sticky cake batter.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-whoopie-pies-with-salted-caramel-frosting/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Scoop mounds of batter, about 1 and 1/2 Tablespoons each, onto prepared baking sheets\u2014about 3 inches apart.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-whoopie-pies-with-salted-caramel-frosting/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes or until the tops spring back when touched. Mine usually take 11 minutes. Allow to cool completely before sandwiching. Make the frosting as they cool.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-whoopie-pies-with-salted-caramel-frosting/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Melt the butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Once melted, add brown sugar and 2 Tablespoons of heavy cream. Whisk constantly until sugar is dissolved. Add salt. Allow to bubble for about 2-3 minutes, whisking every 30 seconds. Remove from heat, pour into a heat-proof mixing bowl, and allow to cool for about 30 minutes.\u00a0With a\u00a0hand or stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, beat in 2 cups confectioners&#8217; sugar and 3 more Tablespoons of heavy cream. Slowly add 1/4 cup &#8211; 1/2 cup more confectioners&#8217; sugar until you reach the desired consistency.\u00a0Add 1 more Tablespoon heavy\u00a0cream if you find the frosting too thick. (Or more if it&#8217;s much too thick!)", "name": "Make the frosting", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-whoopie-pies-with-salted-caramel-frosting/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pair the cookies up based on their size. Keep a close eye on them after around 18 minutes. If using the microwave: place the chocolate in a medium heat-proof bowl or glass liquid measuring cup. Microwave for 20-second increments, stirring after each, until chocolate is completely melted and smooth. Drizzle chocolate over the cooled macaroons. Sprinkle with flaky sea salt, if desired. Sally\u2019s work has been featured on TODAY, Good Morning America, Taste of Home, People, and more.", "sameAs": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "Chocolate Cupcakes with Salted Caramel Frosting", "description": "A shortcut chocolate cupcake recipe topped with creamy salted caramel frosting.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "chocolate cupcakes with salted caramel frosting", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/06/Salted-Caramel-Chocolate-Cupcakes-2-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/06/Salted-Caramel-Chocolate-Cupcakes-2-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/06/Salted-Caramel-Chocolate-Cupcakes-2-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/06/Salted-Caramel-Chocolate-Cupcakes-2.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-fudge-cupcakes-with-salted-caramel-frosting/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 (15.25 ounce) box Devil\u2019s Food or Chocolate Cake Mix (the dry mix)", "1 (3.9 ounce) box Jell-O Chocolate Fudge instant pudding mix", "4 large eggs", "1/2 cup (120ml) vegetable oil", "1/2 cup (120ml) milk", "1 cup (240g) full-fat sour cream", "1/2 cup (8 Tbsp; 113g) unsalted butter, cut into 4 equal pieces", "1 cup (200g) packed light or dark brown sugar (pictured cupcakes use light brown)", "5 Tablespoons heavy cream, divided*", "1/4 teaspoon salt", "2 cups (240g) confectioners&#8217; sugar", "optional: 20 mini pretzel twists and store-bought caramel topping or homemade salted caramel"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C). Line two 12-count muffin pans with liners. Set aside.", "name": "Make the cupcakes", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-fudge-cupcakes-with-salted-caramel-frosting/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a stand or handheld electric mixer on medium speed, beat together the cake mix, pudding mix, eggs, oil, milk and sour cream. Beat until well combined, about 2 minutes. Scoop the batter evenly into cupcake liners.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-fudge-cupcakes-with-salted-caramel-frosting/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 20\u201325 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove the cupcakes from the oven and cool completely in the pan.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-fudge-cupcakes-with-salted-caramel-frosting/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "(This frosting is popular, so we have a separate salted caramel frosting post if you need more help making it.) Combine the butter and brown sugar in a saucepan over medium heat. With a rubber spatula or wooden spoon, stir constantly as the butter melts. Once butter has melted, switch to a whisk to make sure the two are really combined. (Otherwise, you might see an oily layer around the edges where they\u2019re still a bit separated; you do not want that.)\u00a0Once melted butter and brown sugar are combined, add 3 Tablespoons of heavy cream and the salt. Whisk to combine, then stop whisking and attach a candy thermometer to your pan, making sure the bulb is not touching the bottom of the pan.\u00a0Let the caramel boil, giving it a quick whisk every 30 seconds or so, until the temperature reaches 230\u00b0F (110\u00b0C). On my stove, it takes just under 2 minutes.", "name": "Start the frosting", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-fudge-cupcakes-with-salted-caramel-frosting/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the saucepan from heat, give it another quick whisk, and let cool for a minute. Carefully transfer the salted caramel to a heat-proof mixing bowl set on a cooling rack and cool for just 15\u201320 minutes before continuing. The caramel sauce thickens during this time.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-fudge-cupcakes-with-salted-caramel-frosting/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Sift in confectioners\u2019 sugar and add remaining 2 Tablespoons of heavy cream. With a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, beat on medium-low speed until the ingredients are incorporated. Turn mixer up to high speed and beat for 1 minute. Avoid over-mixing or the frosting will begin to &#8220;break&#8221; and separate. Let it sit for at least 20\u201330 minutes before filling your piping bag, to give it a chance to thicken up to a pipeable consistency.", "name": "Finish the frosting", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-fudge-cupcakes-with-salted-caramel-frosting/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Frost cooled cupcakes and garnish with a pretzel twist and salted caramel, if desired.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-fudge-cupcakes-with-salted-caramel-frosting/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover and store leftover cupcakes at room temperature for up to 1 day or in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/chocolate-fudge-cupcakes-with-salted-caramel-frosting/#instruction-step-7"}], "prepTime": "PT30M", "cookTime": "PT22M", "totalTime": "PT3H", "recipeYield": ["20", "20-22 cupcakes"], "recipeCategory": "Cupcakes", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "3", "ratingValue": "5"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Shari"}, "datePublished": "2019-10-05", "reviewBody": "I made this recipe today and it was SO good! Our family has been eating this cake every Thanksgiving for over 50 years, although my great-aunt passed away 15 years ago. This year, I decided to make her recipe into cupcakes since we have fewer people coming. I decided to look up a similar cupcake recipe to see about baking time. I'm thrilled to discover that this is almost her exact recipe! Usually she baked everything from scratch, but this recipe she used the pudding and cake mix! Only difference is she used water instead of milk and added 1 1/2 cups of chocolate chips to the batter. raisins", "8 ounces (224g) full-fat block cream cheese, softened to room temperature", "1/2 cup (8 Tbsp; 113g) unsalted butter, softened to room temperature", "3 cups (360g) confectioners&#8217; sugar", "1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract", "1/8 teaspoon salt", "optional garnish: white chocolate carrot topper (see Notes) and/or finely chopped walnuts or pecans"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F (177\u00b0C).\u00a0Line a 12-cup muffin pan with cupcake liners.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/carrot-cake-cupcakes/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, ginger, and nutmeg together in a large bowl. Add confectioners&#8217; sugar, vanilla extract,\u00a0 and salt. Beat on low speed for 30 seconds and then switch to high speed and beat for 2 minutes. Cover and refrigerate the frosting as the cupcakes finish cooling\u2014this is helpful if you plan to pipe the frosting with a piping bag + tip. Layer with 1 heaping teaspoon Nutella in the center and spoon another heaping Tablespoon of batter on top. If the muffin tins are completely full, that&#8217;s ok. Repeat layering batter and Nutella into each muffin cup. (Recipe makes about 8-9 muffins.) Fill the empty muffin cups halfway with water to help prevent pan from warping. Line two large baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/mocha-chip-biscotti/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large mixing bowl, whisk flour, cocoa powder, brown sugar, baking powder, cinnamon and salt together. Using a pastry cutter or 2 knives, cut in the butter until the mixture is crumbly. Set aside. In a medium bowl, whisk the eggs, instant coffee mixture, oil, and vanilla together. Pour into the flour/butter mixture and gently mix with a large wooden spoon or silicone spatula until everything is just barely moistened. Fold in the chocolate chips.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/mocha-chip-biscotti/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface, and with floured hands, knead lightly until the dough is soft and slightly sticky, about 8-10 times. If it&#8217;s uncontrollably sticky, knead\u00a01 more Tablespoon of flour into the dough. With\u00a0floured hands, divide the dough into two\u00a0and place each half onto a baking sheet. Shape each half\u00a0into an 8-9 inch long roll, patting down until each is about 1/2 inch thick. Using a pastry brush, lightly brush the top and sides of each biscotti slab with egg wash.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/mocha-chip-biscotti/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake in batches (or together)\u00a0for 25-26 minutes, or until the top and sides of the biscotti slabs are lightly browned.\u00a0Remove from the oven, but do not turn off the heat. Allow\u00a0to cool for 10 minutes. Once the slabs are cool enough to handle, cut each\u00a0into\u00a01 inch\u00a0thick slices. Set\u00a0slices cut sides upright, \u00bc inch apart, on the\u00a0baking\u00a0sheets.\u00a0Return to the oven to continue baking for 9 minutes.\u00a0Turn biscotti\u00a0over and bake other side for 9\u00a0minutes. The cookies will be slightly soft in the centers with harder edges. Remove from the oven and allow to cool for 5 minutes on the baking sheet. Then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely before dipping in chocolate. As the biscotti cools, it becomes crunchy. Save the baking sheets for the next step.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/mocha-chip-biscotti/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Process the chopped hazelnuts in a food processor or blender until finely chopped. Alternatively, you can chop them up into smaller pieces with a knife. Set aside. Melt the chocolate in a medium bowl in the microwave (or use a double boiler). The key to melting chocolate in the microwave\u00a0is to do it in small bursts and stir frequently. Chocolate seizes\u00a0so fast, so easily. Melt in 15\u00a0second increments, stirring vigorously with a spoon\u00a0after each increment, until completely melted and smooth. Dip one side of each biscotti cookie in the melted chocolate and immediately sprinkle with the chopped hazelnuts. I do this over the sink to avoid a mess! Use any leftover chocolate to drizzle over the nuts. Place the dipped biscotti back onto the baking sheets and\u00a0allow chocolate to set in the refrigerator or at room temperature, about 30-45 minutes.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/mocha-chip-biscotti/#instruction-step-5"}], "prepTime": "PT15M", "cookTime": "PT45M", "totalTime": "PT1H30M", "recipeYield": ["18", "18 cookies"], "recipeCategory": "Cookies", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "Italian", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "12", "ratingValue": "4.3"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "4"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Erin"}, "datePublished": "2025-01-26", "reviewBody": "Pretty good but kind of a lot of work for the result. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a silicone spatula as needed. Add the eggs and vanilla extract. Beat on medium-high speed until combined, then beat in the sour cream. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. With the mixer on low speed, add the dry ingredients until just incorporated. With the mixer still running on low, slowly pour in the milk until combined. Do not over-mix. The batter will be slightly thick.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/yellow-birthday-cupcakes/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour/spoon the batter into the liners. Make sure to watch the video tutorial below to see me demonstrate the decorating techniques.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "how to decorate sugar cookies", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/how-to-decorate-sugar-cookies-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/how-to-decorate-sugar-cookies-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/how-to-decorate-sugar-cookies-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/how-to-decorate-sugar-cookies.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/decorated-sugar-cookies/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 batch sugar cookies, baked &amp; cooled", "4 cups (480g) confectioners\u2019 sugar, sifted (I use and recommend Domino brand)", "3 Tablespoons meringue powder (not plain egg white powder)", "9\u201310 Tablespoons room-temperature water", "optional for decorating: gel food coloring (I love this\u00a0food coloring kit)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Have your sugar cookies baked and cooled. You can use this recipe, or your favorite recipe for sugar cookies. This icing is enough to ice 2 dozen cookies.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/decorated-sugar-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour sifted confectioners&#8217; sugar, meringue powder, and 9 Tablespoons of water into a large bowl. Using a hand mixer or a stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, beat icing ingredients together on high speed for 1.5\u20132 minutes. When lifting the whisk up off the icing, the icing should drizzle down and smooth out within 5\u201310 seconds. If it&#8217;s too thick, beat in more water 1 Tablespoon at a time. I usually need 10 Tablespoons, but on particularly dry days, I use up to 12\u201314 Tablespoons. Keep in mind that the longer you beat the royal icing, the thicker it becomes. If your royal icing is too thin, just keep beating it to introduce more air, OR you can add more sifted confectioners&#8217; sugar. See this video if you need a visual.", "name": "Make the Icing", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/decorated-sugar-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Color the Icing: If you\u2019d like to tint the icing, divide it into separate bowls for each color, or tint the entire batch one color. A little gel food coloring goes a long way, so use a toothpick to dot the gel into the icing. Stir it in, and then add more to deepen the color if desired. Keep in mind that the more you stir, the thicker the icing becomes. If needed, stir in a few drops of water to maintain the target consistency.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/decorated-sugar-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Fill the Pastry Bag: Fit a pastry bag with a small round piping tip (and use a coupler if you plan to switch icing colors and/or piping tips), such as Wilton piping tip #4. Let that set for 1\u20132 hours, and then pipe on a second layer of icing details once the first layer has dried, such as swirls, handwriting, dots, and other designs. A smaller piping tip, such as Wilton piping tip #2, is ideal for intricate designs/details. Let the icing set again before you stack and store the cookies.", "name": "Two Layers of Icing", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/decorated-sugar-cookies/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "This look gives the icing decoration some dimension. Also, if you&#8217;re using multiple colors, this method keeps the colors from bleeding together. Start with one color, and using Wilton piping tip #4, pipe every other section or area of your cookie, then let it set before you pipe the remaining sections/areas. For the pictured pumpkin and tree cookies, I outline and flood the center, and then the two sides, leaving space between each section. Let the icing dry for at least 30 minutes, until the icing has begun to set. Once the icing is semi-set, you can go ahead and fill the remaining sections with icing.", "name": "Piping Defined Sections", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/decorated-sugar-cookies/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "This technique gives the cookie that same sectioned look as #3, but you don&#8217;t have to wait 30 minutes for the first section to set. Using Wilton piping tip #4, start by piping on the section you want to cover with sprinkles or sparkling sugar. Dip the cookie into the sprinkles, so that they completely coat the icing. Then pipe on your remaining sections.", "name": "Piping Defined Sections + Sprinkles", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/decorated-sugar-cookies/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "When applied to cookies in a thin layer, royal icing completely dries in about 2 hours at room temperature. If icing consistency is too thin and runny, it will take longer to dry. If the icing is applied very thick on cookies, it will also take longer to dry. If you&#8217;re layering royal icing onto cookies for specific designs and need it to set quickly, place cookies in the refrigerator to help speed it up.", "name": "Let the Icing Set", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/decorated-sugar-cookies/#instruction-step-10"}], "prepTime": "PT5M", "cookTime": "", "totalTime": "PT5M", "recipeYield": ["3", "3 cups for 2 dozen cookies"], "recipeCategory": "Dessert", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "2", "ratingValue": "5"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "How to Decorate Sugar Cookies | Sally's Baking Recipes", "description": "Here I'll walk you through 4 simple and approachable decorating techniques using royal icing. Add the brown sugar and beat on high speed for 1 minute until creamed together fairly well. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a silicone spatula as needed. On medium-high speed, beat in the egg and vanilla extract until combined. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. With the mixer on low speed, add the dry ingredients in three additions alternating with the hot water/molasses and mixing each addition just until incorporated. Avoid overmixing. Batter will be thin. Whisk out any big lumps.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/spiced-gingerbread-loaf/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake\u00a0for around 50-60\u00a0minutes or until the gingerbread loaf is\u00a0baked through. All ovens are different and your loaf\u00a0could take a little more or less time. To test for doneness, insert a toothpick into the center of the gingerbread loaf. If it comes out clean with only a couple moist (not wet) crumbs, it is done. To save time, make the caramel as the cookie dough chills.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Sally", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/about-sally-mckenney/"}, "keywords": "caramel hazelnut sandwich cookies", "image": ["https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/caramel-hazelnut-sandwich-cookie-225x225.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/caramel-hazelnut-sandwich-cookie-260x195.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/caramel-hazelnut-sandwich-cookie-320x180.jpg", "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/caramel-hazelnut-sandwich-cookie.jpg"], "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/caramel-hazelnut-sandwich-cookies/", "recipeIngredient": ["2/3 cup (65g) hazelnuts (raw, roasted, chopped, or whole)*", "2/3 cup (135g) packed light or dark brown sugar,\u00a0divided", "2 and 1/2 cups (313g) all-purpose flour\u00a0(spooned &amp; leveled), plus more for rolling", "1/2 teaspoon baking powder", "1 teaspoon ground cinnamon", "1/2 teaspoon salt", "1 cup (16 Tbsp; 226g) unsalted\u00a0butter, softened to room temperature", "1 large egg, at room temperature", "1 and 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract", "optional for dusting: 2 Tablespoons (16g) confectioners\u2019 sugar", "1 cup\u00a0(200g)\u00a0granulated sugar\u00a0(make sure it\u2019s labeled \u201cpure cane\u201d)*", "6 Tablespoons (85g) unsalted butter, room temperature cut up into 6 pieces", "1/2 cup\u00a0(120ml)\u00a0heavy cream, at room temperature", "1/2 teaspoon\u00a0salt"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the hazelnuts and 1/3 cup (67g) brown sugar in a food processor. Pulse into a very fine crumb. Set aside.", "name": "Make the cookies", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/caramel-hazelnut-sandwich-cookies/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt together in a medium bowl. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/caramel-hazelnut-sandwich-cookies/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat the butter and remaining 1/3 cup (67g) brown sugar together on high speed until completely smooth and creamy, about 3 minutes. (Here\u2019s a helpful tutorial if you need guidance on\u00a0how to cream butter and sugar.) Add the egg and vanilla extract, and beat on high speed until combined, about 1 minute. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl and beat again as needed to combine. Mixture may look separated or curdled\u2014that&#8217;s ok.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/caramel-hazelnut-sandwich-cookies/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the flour mixture and ground hazelnut mixture to the wet ingredients and beat on low speed until combined. The dough will be crumbly at first and appear too dry, but it will finally come together after a couple minutes of beating. Yields about 2 lbs of dough.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/caramel-hazelnut-sandwich-cookies/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Divide the dough into 2 equal portions, flatten into 1-inch thick discs, and wrap each in parchment paper or plastic wrap. Chill the discs in the refrigerator for at least 3 hours and up to 4 days. If chilling for longer than 3 hours, allow to sit at room temperature for at least 30 minutes before rolling because the dough will be too hard and crumble. (Time-saving tip: As the cookie dough chills, you can make the caramel filling in step 11. The caramel must cool and thicken before sandwiching.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/caramel-hazelnut-sandwich-cookies/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F (180\u00b0C). Line baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone baking mats. Set aside.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/caramel-hazelnut-sandwich-cookies/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove 1 disc of chilled cookie dough from the refrigerator. Generously flour a work surface, as well as your hands and the rolling pin. The dough may become sticky as you work, so keep extra flour nearby to use as needed. Alternatively, the dough may crack when rolling out. Wait a few minutes for it to soften back up. The more you work with it, the softer it will become. Roll out the disc until 1/4 inch thick. Using a 2 or 2.5-inch cookie cutter, cut dough into shapes. Always be gentle with this fragile dough and work slowly. Reroll the remaining dough and continue cutting until all is used. Repeat with the second disc of dough. You should have about 50-64 cookies, depending on size.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/caramel-hazelnut-sandwich-cookies/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Optional hole in the top cookies: Using a 1-inch cookie cutter, cut a hole into the center of half of the cookies. Let\u2019s call these cookies the \u201cdonut cookies\u201d because of that center hole. These will be fragile, so handle with care.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/caramel-hazelnut-sandwich-cookies/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Arrange the whole cookies and the donut cookies 2 inches apart and on separate baking sheets (because the donut cookies may take less time to bake).", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/caramel-hazelnut-sandwich-cookies/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake the whole cookies for about 11-13 minutes or until lightly browned around the edges, and bake the donut cookies for about 10-12 minutes. Rotate the baking sheets halfway through the bake time. Allow cookies to cool on the baking sheets for 5 minutes. Dust the \u201cdonut cookies\u201d with confectioners\u2019 sugar, and then transfer all of the cookies to a wire rack to cool completely before assembling.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/caramel-hazelnut-sandwich-cookies/#instruction-step-10"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Heat granulated sugar in a medium heavy-duty saucepan (avoid using non-stick) over medium heat, stirring constantly with a high heat resistant silicone spatula or wooden spoon. Sugar will form clumps and eventually melt into a thick brown, amber-colored liquid as you continue to stir. Once sugar is completely melted, immediately stir in the butter until melted and combined. Be careful in this step because the caramel will bubble rapidly when the butter is added. If you notice the butter separating or if the sugar clumps up, remove from heat and vigorously whisk to combine it again. (If you\u2019re nervous for splatter, wear kitchen gloves. Keep whisking until it comes back together, even if it takes 3-4 minutes. It will eventually\u2014just keep whisking. Return to heat when it\u2019s combined again.) After the butter has melted and combined with the caramelized sugar, cook for 1 minute without stirring. Slowly stir in 1/2 cup of heavy cream. Since the heavy cream is colder than the hot caramel, the mixture will rapidly bubble when added. After all the heavy cream has been added, stop stirring and boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in the salt. Cool caramel for at least 3 hours at room temperature. Caramel thickens as it cools.", "name": "Make + Cool the Caramel", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/caramel-hazelnut-sandwich-cookies/#instruction-step-11"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spoon 2 heaping teaspoons of caramel onto bottom of whole cookies.\u00a0Carefully top each with a donut cookie and gently press down to create a cookie sandwich.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/caramel-hazelnut-sandwich-cookies/#instruction-step-12"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cookies will stay fresh covered at room temperature for 2 days or in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/caramel-hazelnut-sandwich-cookies/#instruction-step-13"}], "prepTime": "PT4H", "cookTime": "PT10M", "totalTime": "PT4H30M", "recipeYield": ["24", "24 2.5-inch or 32 2-inch cookie sandwiches"], "recipeCategory": "Cookies", "cookingMethod": "Baking", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "10", "ratingValue": "4.9"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Chris"}, "datePublished": "2022-01-03", "reviewBody": "Hi Sally! (If it&#8217;s helpful, see this parchment paper rounds for cakes video &amp; post.)", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/snickerdoodle-cake/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the cake flour, salt, baking powder, and baking soda together. Set aside.", "name": "Make the cake:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/snickerdoodle-cake/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a handheld or stand mixer fitted with a paddle or whisk attachment, beat the butter and sugar together on high speed until smooth and creamy, about 3 minutes. Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl with a silicone spatula as needed. Beat in the 3 eggs, 2 egg whites, and vanilla extract on high speed until combined, about 2 minutes. (Mixture will look curdled as a result of the egg liquid and solid butter combining.) Scrape down the sides and up the bottom of the bowl as needed. With the mixer running on low speed, slowly add the dry ingredients. With the mixer still running on low speed, slowly pour in the buttermilk then mix just until combined. You may need to whisk it all by hand to make sure there are no lumps at the bottom of the bowl. The batter will be slightly thick.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/snickerdoodle-cake/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour batter evenly into cake pans. Pour the melted butter on top and mix just until combined. Use immediately in the cake batter (next step) because the longer it sits out, the harder it will get as a result of the butter solidifying.", "name": "For the cinnamon swirl", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/snickerdoodle-cake/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Drop small spoonfuls of the cinnamon swirl on each of the unbaked cakes. Some pieces will remain as chunks (that&#8217;s fine!) and some will swirl into the batter.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/snickerdoodle-cake/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for around 23-26 minutes or until the cakes are baked through. To test for doneness, insert a toothpick into the center of the cake. If it comes out clean, it\u2019s done. Allow cakes to cool completely in the pans set on a wire rack. The cakes must be completely cool before frosting and assembling.", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/snickerdoodle-cake/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl using a handheld mixer or stand mixer fitted with a whisk or paddle attachment, beat the butter on medium speed until creamy, about 2 minutes. Switch the mixer up to medium-high speed and add the cream cheese one piece at a time, mixing until each has combined before adding the next. Once the cream cheese is combined, add the brown sugar and beat on medium-high speed until combined, about 1 minute. Stop the mixer and add the cinnamon, confectioners\u2019 sugar, heavy cream, vanilla extract, and salt. Turn the mixer on low speed and beat for 30 seconds, then turn the mixer up to medium-high speed and beat until completely combined and creamy. Add more confectioners\u2019 sugar if frosting seems too thin\u2014I usually add another 1/4 cup (30g) of confectioners&#8217; sugar. You can add more heavy cream if frosting seems too thick or an extra pinch of salt if frosting is too sweet. (I usually add another pinch of salt.) If you crave extra flavor, add a little more cinnamon and/or vanilla extract.", "name": "Make the frosting:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/snickerdoodle-cake/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a large serrated knife, slice the domes off the cooled cakes (a semi-thin layer) to create a flat surface. Discard domes (or crumble over ice cream!). Place 1 cake layer on a cake stand, cake turntable, or serving plate. Evenly spread about 1 and 1/2 cups of frosting on top. Top with 2nd cake layer and evenly spread another 1 and 1/2 cups of frosting on top. Top with the third cake layer. I decorated my snickerdoodle cake with a crumb coat, which makes it a semi-naked style cake. To recreate this, spread a thin layer of frosting around the sides and top of the cake (save extra frosting for the top in the next step). An icing spatula and bench scraper are helpful for creating this look. (If you need a visual, see my Naked Cake video tutorial.) Chill the crumb coated cake uncovered in the refrigerator or freezer for at least 30 minutes to help set the crumb coat.", "name": "Level the cakes &amp; add the crumb coat:\u00a0", "url": "https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/snickerdoodle-cake/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spread a little extra frosting on top of the cake and use any leftover frosting to pipe detail around the edges, if desired. It is so moist and the combination of flavors is perfect!! I have never had cake layers bake up so flat, which is what you want. I only had to slightly level one layer.  I did use baking strips, but even with baking strips, I usually have to level my cake layers quite a bit.  I used the gram measurements. I did not use the cream cheese frosting. I had planned to, but I accidentally bought low fat cream cheese, so I made a regular cinnamon, brown sugar buttercream. I had thought about using 8 inch cake pans, but I used the recommended 9 inch.  I am so happy I did. It is the perfect height and is a big cake.  An 8 inch would have been too tall. Also, it baked in the shortest recommended time on 350F in my gas oven.  I highly recommend this cake.  It is one of the best tasting cakes I have ever eaten.  This is  the first recipe I have made of Sally's and it won't be the last."}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Kati Abbott"}, "datePublished": "2025-10-31", "reviewBody": "This is the most incredible cake I've ever made. Bake the remaining donut batter\u00a0(there is usually enough batter for 1-2 more donuts) and once baked, transfer to the wire rack.
